course.subject: MATH
course.name: Partial Differential Equations
course.description: Derivations of the Laplace equations, the wave equations and diffusion equation; Methods to solve equations: separation of variables, Fourier series and integrals and characteristics; maximum principles, Green's functions.
course.prerequisites: MATH 2011/MATH 2023/MATH 3043 and MATH 2111/MATH 2121/MATH 2131/MATH 2350 and MATH 2350/MATH 2351/MATH 2352

reviews.author: Techni
reviews.title: 得過且過
reviews.comment_content:
如果你以為你讀得好ODE就可以應付到E個Course，咁我覺得你要再重新諗下啦…
輕鬆既有︰
First Order PDE
Classification of Second Order PDE
少少難既有︰
Wave Equation (de Alembert's Formula)
Heat Equation
Method of Seperation
Fourier Series
難既有︰
Proof of Uniqueness
Laplace Equation
變態既有︰
Laplace Equation (Possion's Formula)
Green's Identity
reviews.comment_teaching:
堂可走，不解釋。
但係一定要講既係，HU, Wei係我見過最百街既Tutor。
大家都知道，好多MathsCourse都係過40%就起碼Pass既，而我相信，E個Course既HW佔40%，就係想保你做齊哂功課就Pass姐。
但係E個百街Tutor，我認真做佐頭幾份，比佢扣分，跟住我忍吾住去抄Source(或多或少改佐少少字)，又比佢扣分，最後我直接完全抄兩份比佢，佢仲係扣我分。
我明白叫我地做功課都係想睇下我地明吾明DMaterial姐，但係本身一個禮拜抄一份都己經又哂紙又哂時間架啦，宜家你仲要扣埋我D細既大意錯既分，吾係咁講得過去呀？
跟住到考試，佢又係亂咁改我地份卷，係又扣，吾係又扣，攞埋我地既Grade尼較非，想隻抽？
最好笑既係，到Check卷果日，佢遲佐成半粒鐘先到，仲要辛苦埋個教授，要教授自己親自攞堆卷同Print答案比我地…我見住個Professor係咁打電話比佢，Where are you now? Where is the answer sheet? ...，跟住我又到見住HU, Wei岩岩起身未洗頭既樣，同埋個教授又要好尷尬，又要強顏歡笑咁怒睥佢，真係笑佐…
總結，我好希望佢比人抄。
reviews.comment_grading:
今個Sem有74個讀，算係個大班，所以拉Curve
不過有Tutor話如果係小班既會用Absolute Grading
HW 40%，Mean ~95/100
Final 60%，Mean ~75/100
王小平親口話AB Range既有近60%。
利申︰我Below Mean少少，B-
reviews.comment_workload:
HW 10份，我建議抄，仲要抄足哂︰
其一，抄就2粒鐘內，自己做就吾知啦；
其二，有多D機會滿分(至少我有份抄足既都滿分既)。
王小平出既Final偏淺，吾算太難攞高分。

reviews.author: K. H.
reviews.title: PDE Course Taught in PG Approach
reviews.comment_content:
NOTE: This version is different from the ordinary one (the one taught by Professor WANG) and is only for reference

As the professor used to teach the PDE course for PG student, the reference book used is for PG student and the contents taught is also different from usual one. The syllabus is as the following (listed in the sequence of teaching):

1. Distribution Theory (*)
2. Characteristics method
3. Maximum Principle for Heat and Laplace Equation
4. Fourier transform
5. Schwartz distribution (Tempered Distribution) (*)
6. PDE with boundaries
7. Duhamel's Principle (*)
8. Seperation of variables

in which I believe the ones with asterisk are not taught in the ordinary version. Besides, the Professor assumed the students are familiar with real analysis (at least for some terminology like "compact"), complex analysis (for computing contour integral for Fourier transform) and some special notations (like index) used in the reference book. You should at least know a little bit about the contents above before enrolling into this course. This course also put emphasis on both computation and proof, so you should at least be familiar with writing proofs. Despite of the above prerequisites, this course provides more intuition behind the principle of solving different PDE and it develops different tools more rigorously, so I recommend student who want to study PDE in a more rigorous approach and learn more different methods in solving PDE to take this course.
reviews.comment_teaching: As for this semester, it is a small class (only 16 people enrolled), Professor Gunther takes a relatively relaxed pace to teach. He is also passionate in helping student to understand the contents. However his approach is rather disorganised and sometimes it is difficult to understand his motivation in proving some lemmas/theorems. It is also a little bit difficult to recognise his handwriting and no lecture notes are provided. So it relies a lot on the student's own effort to understand the contents. The TA mostly teaches how to solve the assignment problems so it is worth to go.
reviews.comment_grading:
The professor promised a decent grading during class so the grading is not bad. Homework takes up 40% of the total score while final takes up 60%. The statistics are as the following (the mark in bracket is my own score):
Homework 1: Mean: 38.8/50 (50)
Homework 2: Mean: 32/40 (40)
Homework 3: Mean: 39.93/50 (50)
Homework 4: Mean: 39.6/50 (49)
Homework 5: Mean: 39.93/50 (50)
Final: Mean: 53.93/100 (70)
Total: Mean: 64.08/100 (81.84)
and I got an A-. The TA also promised to give a decent score if you tried hard in homework so those marks are relatively easy to get.
reviews.comment_workload: As mentioned in "Teaching" section, you have to pay a lot of effort to get familiar with the new contents, especially the professor first taught distribution theory which involves some knowledge of real analysis and topology and is completely new to all of us who attended the class. The assignments are also tough despite of the decent score guaranteed by the TA. We are given two weeks to solve the assignment and on average it takes me 6 hours to solve. Some which requires writing very long proofs even took me a few day as I am not familiar in writing proofs, therefore I strongly advice those who are not familiar in writing proofs not to enrol in this course.

reviews.author: YS
reviews.title: PDE = ODE * Mul Cal
reviews.comment_content:
主要而言

A. 介紹wave同heat equation

B. Boundary problems 呢個幾重要
1. 主要係講Dirichlet同Neumann呢兩隻condition 講啲PDE喺呢兩隻condition之下原本條式會係咩樣
2. 要用separation of variables去solve條原本條式 總次分完var就做兩次ODE咁款 做完夾番啲conditions就搞掂

C. Fourier Series
1. Sine series, cosine series, full series
2. (雖然學過ODE嘅話可能見過吓) 宜家大家可以知埋點搵各種series嘅coefficients 包括之前solve出來條式嘅coefficients

D. Harmonic functions (in diff. shapes of domain) 呢度開始要畀多啲時間 開始有埋如果個unknown係in vector form應該點搵條式

E. Green's identities & functions 真係PDE同Mul Cal溝埋 請自求多福

整體嚟講各有深淺 前面三part ok part D唔太難 不過part E真係明得面嗰浸
reviews.comment_teaching:
王教授教書無乜特別好定差 基本上都係跟書講/寫 (本書又係對大家嘅理解能力幾高要求) 可能會用啲本書以外嘅例子示範個thm咁 佢又會將每個禮拜講到既內容放上course webpage (亦即係其實大家搵到本e-book就可以走曬堂)



ta就... 有心嘅 但係講啲野好唔明同好似同教授講嘅唔關事 :o) 之前ode (都係佢做ta) 都已經係咁
reviews.comment_grading:
無其他review參考好難講好定差

但係當今個sem得6X人 絕大部份都交齊hw嘅情況下 final對個grade就顯得格外重要

都係嗰句 hw唔係靠抄都唔會差得去邊

另 check卷期間望到至少兩個滿分 #adore#
reviews.comment_workload:
final唔少得
每個禮拜都要tutorial期間交hw 但係好似有做足就有分 (唔肯定 未攞番嚟睇) 唔識仲可以即場問吓ta

無mt嫁between

hw 40% final 60%

好似交齊hw已經pass :D
(大部份題目都有答案 自己google吓)

reviews.author: id@a
reviews.comment_content:
Textbook: Strauss PDE
PDF available

Topics:
1 First order linear PDE
2 Wave equation and its principles
3 Heat equation and its principles
4 Separation of variable and Fourier series
5 Laplace equation by separation of variable
6 Laplace equation by Greens function and Greens Identities
7 Wave in space
8 Fourier Transform (not covered in HW and exam)

0 REMEMBER THE PRINCIPLE OF SUPERPOSITION!!!!!!!
1 understanding the algorithm is enough
2~3 don't need to understand how to derive the solution formula, but being familiar with the intuition and proof of those principles are not bad.
4 understanding the algorithm is enough, I omit the proof of completeness because they are difficult
5 remember solution formula
6 be familiar with finding Greens function and those surface integrals
7 Proof are difficult and I think he will never be covered in exam, be familiar with surface integra and jot down the two formula to your cheat sheet is enough
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor:
Not good and not bad, just directly read the content of the textbook Strauss PDE, but still suggest to attend lectures because:

1. He still adds something new
2. Not everything in the book will be covered

I suggest you preview the related material before the lecture and attend the lectures as revision.

TA:
Our TA is Chen Chuqi and she's quite well. She gives clear explanations of the course materials and replies emails seriously. Also, she gives hints for assignment questions that certain student considered difficult and postpone the deadline for two assignments which are due in midterm and final, which helps quite a lot.
reviews.comment_grading:
HW 35%
Exam 65%

HW:
I've forgot the statistics of HW because they are removed from canvas.
However, I remember I get 33.6/35 while I am below median in HW1 and above UQ in the rest.

Exam:
Average: 48.18/100
90-100:            2  students
80-89:              5
70-79:              2
60-69:              9
50-59:              7
40-49:              5
30-39:              7
<30                  11
me: 81

Final grade: 86% -> A

In HW I guess I am top 20%, in exam, I should be top15%, so I think my final grade is around top 17%

I think the top 17% -> A is quite good because in most math courses, you can only get an A- by being top 17%
reviews.comment_workload:
4 HWs

Each consists of 5~12 questions.

He posts one part of the assignment after each lecture, each may take you one hour or less to finish because most questions are easy. But still, some are difficult.

Since homework questions are mostly from textbook (slightly revised only), no matter if it is difficult or not, I suggest you to check your answer here to secure ~full mark in homework.
https://www.math.cuhk.edu.hk/course/1516/math4220

Of course I don't suggest you directly copy the answer because not doing any exercise will likely make you f*** up in the final exam.

Also, it will be better if you can do extra exercises.

And this course requires some:
Inhomogeneous second order linear ODE
Directional derivative and gradient
Line and surface integral
Revising them in winter/summer before taking this course may help.

reviews.author: _NattU_
reviews.comment_content:
Official Synopsis: Derivations of the Laplace equations, the wave equations and diffusion equation; Methods to solve equations:
separation of variables, Fourier series and integrals and characteristics; maximum principles, Green's functions.

The content is based on Strauss's PDE book and covers Chapters 1, 2, 4, 5, 6, 7, and selected sections in Chapters 9 and 12.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor did not provide any lecture slides and asked us to make our own notes during the lectures. I like the idea since writing it down helps you solidify your knowledge and gives you some extra practice.  (He also goes over rather slowly to give you enough time to copy it down). If you're not a big fan of making your own lecture notes, the final is an open-book exam so borrowing the textbook from the library works as well as all the relevant equations are present there.

Idk about the others but I like his easy-to-follow teaching style. Plus, he's got good vibes!
reviews.comment_grading:
The course grade is determined based on the following assessment scheme:
- Assignments (35%) (4 in total)
- Open-book Final Exam (65%)

My HW scores: 35/40, 43/45, 92/100, 55/55.

Final Exam Score: 79/100 (Mean: 62.5)

Total Course score: 84.17%

Grade: A-

There were 10 students who scored higher than me on the finals. Assuming they had a relatively good performance on the HW, they should've gotten A range too. 3 students got 100% on the final so they're probably A+ students. (Our class size was 41). Despite what the other course reviews say, Prof. XIANG turned out to be an ok grader, at least for this particular course. Also, if anyone is deterred by the high scores you need for A range (mid-to-high 80s), then you should note that the exam questions are fairly standard and it isn't that difficult to get a decent score. So the grade thresholds seem acceptable.
reviews.comment_workload: 4 Assignments only. Prof releases it in parts after lectures (each one may consist of 1-3 questions). The first two assignments are relatively short but the last two might take you an entire day if you pile them up.

reviews.author: UnconMarketeers
reviews.title: Reading (aloud) course: Partial differential equation
reviews.comment_content:
What a brilliant professor! Fortunately he chose a friendly, popular PDE textbook. If he adopt a more advanced PDE book like Evans' PDE book, my life will be ruined.

Standard linear PDE content anyway - Heat equation, wave equation, Laplace equation.

Various methods for solving them are discussed (depending on domain of the PDE defined), like deducing solution formula, method of separation of variable, Green's function method and so on. Fourier series is also discussed, one purpose is to retrieve the coefficients from the series solution (from separate variable) of, say, Laplace equation on disk domain. Needless to say, the good properties like maximum principle, uniqueness of solution and so on are also included.
(Try to compare holomorphic functions and harmonic functions, they enjoy similar properties. Think about, why?)

Lastly the professor covered some introductory content of distribution theory and Fourier transform. I personally think learning these important (and beautiful) topics from this book is a joke. Why not learn them from more proper real analysis and functional analysis textbook?

I give this area C because I respect the knowledge covered in the syllabus.
reviews.comment_teaching:
In this course, you may enjoy your dear professor offering a reading course for you - by literally reading aloud his powerpoint that 100% of content are copied from the textbook. Therefore your fate is to read the textbook by yourself. What a reading course!

Also uh, if you miss Dr Avery Ching uh, you can also take this course uh! In the lecture uh, he will definitely end every sentences with 'uh', just like what Avery did with 'um' instead of "uh" uh.

Now tell you guys a joke: At the beginning of this course, he said he will not put his powerpoint to canvas, and said that students are expected to attend the lecture and hand-copy the powerpoint content.
reviews.comment_grading:
35% hw, 65% final. This is reasonable for such a course that contains many heavy calculations and technical skills. But according to the review of MATH4335, let's guess: will there be even less than 3 A range students???

Update (1/6): Okay, it seems that there are far more than 3 A range students - After releasing the grade, it seems that >80% of overall score leads to A range, and if you are familiar with the content, it is not an impossible figure to get in exam. I tend to adjust this scope from E to C. However, I reject to give a better score in this scope, in memory of the ones who sacrificed their grades in MATH4335.
reviews.comment_workload: 4 hws, extracting about 1 question corresponding to 1 lecture. The hws do not dominate my time in overall, comparing with other courses.

reviews.author: RickyPang
reviews.title: Hard introductory course to PDE
reviews.comment_content:
The content is mainly based on the L.C. Evans PDE book, Chapter 2-3 and with some extra stuffs:

1) Heat equations (Fourier transform, Heat Kernel)
2) Wave equation( Transport equation, d' Alembert Principles, Finite Speed of propagation, Energy method, Duhamel's principle)
3) Heat equation in Full space (Maximum Principle, Regularity of Heat equation, Heat kernel, Energy method, Duhamel's principle)
3) Laplace Equation( Harmonicity, Maximum principle, Perron methods, Green's function)
4) Method of characteristics( First order PDE, Conservation Laws)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Jin is a very nice and passion teacher. He explains the concept very well.

For the TA Mr. Du, he is very helpful. Sometimes he will teach us to do the homework during the tutorial sessions. Besides, he will teach us some important concepts which are important in analysis.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading Scheme:
60% HW + 40% Final

Absolute Grading
≥ 95 %=A+
≥ 90 %=A
≥ 85 %=A-
≥ 80 %=B+
≥ 75 %=B
≥ 70 %=B-
≥ 60 %=C+
≥ 55 %=C
≥ 50 %=C-
≥ 40 %=D
< 40 %=F

For Pass/Fail,
≥ 40 %=P
< 40 %=F

There are 10 homework and 1 final:
I almost got >80 in each homework and I got 67/100 in my final. Based on the above grading scheme, I got a B finally.
reviews.comment_workload: There are 10 homework and some are challenging. However, if you encounter any difficulty in homework, you can directly ask TA during the tutorial session or email to Professor Jin to discuss your thoughts. Besides, Stack Exchange is your best friend!!!

reviews.author: Eggtart
reviews.comment_content:
同上
雖然有16個人enroll，不過睇返hw同exam個mean應該得13個有繼續讀，可能大家都比頭幾課嚇親(?)
一開波講distribution，頭幾堂每次落堂都好似發咗場夢咁，過咗大半個sem先開始知個course教緊咩。
個人覺得我應該讀多兩個sem先take呢個course，不過由theory學起係幾有趣嘅。
reviews.comment_teaching:
教咗半個sem個Prof.就走咗，剩返d topics就由佢d colleagues教。
Tutorials多數都係教hw題目，完咗都會send返份tutor note/additional material比我地。TA好好人，落堂問/hw唔識會逐步慢慢解比你聽:)
reviews.comment_workload:
5份hw每份~5題，認真做大概幾日做完Exam好似有兩題出返功課，剩返嗰d都係人做嘅。
最大workload係同本textbook對望(…)

reviews.comment_content:

1-3好易 記熟個方法點做就得

PS 上網搵到ebook, 有書可以走堂

homework 40%
final 60%

我:

reviews.comment_workload:
10份功課 上網搵到答案
唔建議抄 最好自己做下 跟住對答案
因為考試啲題目同功課差唔多

reviews.author: grqm
reviews.comment_content:
Three main parts:

1. Wave equation, diffusion equation
2. Boundary value problems (separation of variables) and Fourier series
3. Harmonic functions, Green's functions

The first part and second part are very easy, particularly if you have taken an ODE course before. The third part may appear a bit intimidating at first but the tools are actually quite similar.
reviews.comment_teaching: Can't say because I never went to class! He seems nice though.
reviews.comment_grading:
40% Homework
60% Final exam

Exam problems were similar to those in homework which are just textbook problems.
reviews.comment_workload:
No midterm! But sometimes it could take a few hours to finish one assignment, especially in later chapters.

With almost no theorem and proof, this is one of the easiest maths courses.

reviews.author: PimpDaddy
reviews.title: Gunther made it worth taking
reviews.comment_content: You will learn about the canonical types of PDEs and how to solve them. These are elliptical, parabolic, and hyperbolic equations with solutions via Fourier Transform, separation of variables, etc. You will also cover basic boundary/initial value problems as well as proving uniqueness and existence of solutions. Instead of teaching you how to solve a specific problem, he teaches you a very generalised approach to solving PDEs. This means the class isn't your ordinary mathematics class in HKUST. Unfortunately, this approach is also quite theoretical. We didn't actually see or solve a single PDE until halfway through the semester! Just so you get the flavour, we followed Andras Vasy's book mainly. This is a more advanced book that focused on 'distributions' because they yield derivatives of discontinuous functions. A cool generalised approach!
reviews.comment_teaching: Gunther was a good instructor because he has an extraordinary background. He has been teaching for many decades and it shows. However, he only writes on the board by hand and his handwriting is terrible. He is also a pretty research-oriented person, so he can't really tell you how to solve a specific problem. I enjoyed taking his class a lot because of his teaching style.
reviews.comment_grading: The grading was just fine. You have some homeworks every 2 weeks and a final exam. No midterm. The TA is told to grade leniently because our questions were very very very theoretical. He told us the answers in the tutorial before the homework deadline, so you should get full marks for the homework. The exam is set by the TA and was based on the homeworks. Only a small upper division class, so the grading was reasonable.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was relatively light. Your homeworks were certainly challenging but there were no projects, midterm, or presentations.

reviews.author: billy1996
reviews.comment_content:
1.Introduction & first-order equations
2.Wave equations and diffusion equations
3.Boundary value problems, separation of variables
4.Fourier series

6.Green's function

reviews.author: eggyfx
reviews.comment_content: Basic problems in PDE, boudary problems etc. May be useful for physics students.
reviews.comment_teaching: Prof Wang likes to write on his iPad, and his handwriting is hard to recognize, his teaching basically follows the textbook, so no need to attend the lectures.
reviews.comment_grading:
40% Homework, 60% Final exam.
The TA Wei Xiaoyu is very nice, he said you would get full homework mark only by handing in the homework on time.
The difficulty degree and form of final exam is similar to homework, if you do homework by yourself it's easy to get high mark.
reviews.comment_workload: One homework per week, easy to find answers online.
